sections.name: Giant Solifugid
sections.text: The smallest of giant solifugids are still large enough to harry desert traders and their mounts.

link.name: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89
link.alt: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89

sections.name: Solifugid
Solifugid Burrows
sections.text: Most species of solifugid lay their eggs in burrows. The female doesn't eat while guarding her eggs, and thus fights even more aggressively against any creatures she deems potential threats to her brood. The bodies of wayward adventurers often litter such burrows, though this does little to deter other fortune-hunters from trying their luck in such treasure-laden nests.

link.name: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89
link.alt: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89

sections.text: Giant solifugids are monstrous vermin with six legs and two large feeding appendages easily mistaken for an additional pair of legs. They are often called camel spiders, sun spiders, or wind scorpions, despite the fact that they are neither spiders nor scorpions.

link.name: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89
link.alt: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89

link.name: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89
link.alt: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89

traits.name: Animal
traits.text: An animal is a creature with a relatively low intelligence. It typically doesn’t have an Intelligence ability modifier over –4, can’t speak languages, and can’t be trained in Intelligence-based skills.

link.name: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89
link.alt: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 89

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

ability.name: Pounce
ability.text: The giant solifugid Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the giant solifugid began this action hidden, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

universal_monster_ability.name: Rend
universal_monster_ability.text: A Rend entry lists a Strike the monster has.
universal_monster_ability.requirement: The monster hit the same enemy with two consecutive Strikes of the listed type in the same round.
universal_monster_ability.effect: The monster automatically deals that Strike’s damage again to the enemy.
